channel.title: Laws of a forum...?
channel.description:
You don't follow any rules that apply to real life.. because obviously nothing online effects you irl.
Everything online has it's own laws, specifically the forums.
1)say wtf you want 2)flame wtf you want 3)you opinion doesn't have to matter 4)Nothing happens to you online, so follow numbers one and two. 5)It's words, It's impersonal, people and their opinions matter only if you make them matter.
You'll learn that no one cares wtf goes on around here only for the simple fact that it's impersonal. If we were having this discussion in real life, everyone would show emotion. You can't see emotion online, you're stuck into those laws by default. No one would be saying these same words in real life. No One.
We're all here to see other peoples views on a certain topic, whether you like it or not. A forum is what you want it to be. Flame back flamers as much as you want, complain about errors, grammar fixes, fact checking, and everything you have to be picky about, it will all just be a loop. It doesn't end for the plain fact that it doesn't have to. You can choose to be the nice guy, but you'll always have the people who don't want a nice guy. Everyone makes their own view of the forum, we can't agree about everything. Including the laws...
My point is, you can't post stuff on here without knowing that you have another ego. This bs that exists online, only exists online. It's letters on a screen, they can't effect you. So go ahead and say whatever the hell you want, because no one's gonna really get at you. They're sitting in front of a computer, what can they possibly do other than move their fingers around a bit.
